title: 3 man premade vs full solo just happened in silver, GJ Rito.
body: I am in god damn silver elo and I encountered 3 man premade against full solo team, nice job rito, keep lying about how dynamic queue is balanced.

replies.body: I mean, this could happen in higher elos.... but there's more than enough players in silver/bronze so there's no excuse.
Wow another one of these threads.......{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
Wow another comment complaining about soloQ posts

How can people know that they're agaisnt a premade? Or that they themselves aren't playing with either a 2, 3 or 4 man premade in their team?

Are peope psychics or is there a tool I'm not aware of?
there is a "recently played with" thingy in OP.GG, if you check the match history of your enemy, and other players in the enemy team recently played with that player, they are in a premade.
if you are looking it up then you are already doing it wrong. it's just gonna tilt yourself, and make you play worse, which will make you play worse.
Or just notice the "xDBAGSx" tag on the side during select (on your own team), and in the scoreboard in-game, and on the actual players during the game.

This happens all the time, why is that surprising? 

You're thinking of the figures that Riot gave about how rare it is for five solo players to be matched against a five-player premade team.  That is the only situation that they gave numbers for.

Full solo teams vs teams with some premade players happen all the time.

I'm just surprised by how Rito was completely lying and how broken the system was. I knew it was broken but I didn't expect it to be that broken. Literally just last day I faced a double duo team as full solo, now I'm facing 3man premades as full solo, literally happening on a daily basis.

Where were they lying?
They never said that you don't get matched as a team of solos vs a team of 3.

Also, how exactly would it be better if you also had a team of three on your own team? 
Wouldn't you still be a solo player against a premade?

they said a non 5man premade has <1% chance of not matching against a team of the same size.
also if my bot lane is also a premade they shouldn't feed this hard, by my observation they aren't really mechanically worse than the enemy bot lane duo.

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000b000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T14:04:11.287+0000)
>
> they said a non 5man premade has <1% chance of not matching against a team of the same size.

Notice how that's not a 0% chance.

Now go Cry elsewhere, no one else cares
small possibilities are meaningless when only a small sample size is presented, but it happened to me twice in less than 10 games, the percentage is clearly higher rito id just lying.

So if there are 10 marbles in a bag and 5 are red and 5 are blue and I pull 1 out at a time and put it back after grabbing it and I do it 10 times and pull 8 red and 2 blue that means that someone lied about me having a 50/50 chance right? Or doesn't it mean the sample size I used is too small? just because it happened to you twice in less than 10 games doesn't mean they lied. It means that you got unlucky and pulled another red.

that is a cheating logic
in your example you are RANDOMLY picking up marbles, the result is COMPLETELY RANDOM.
Meanwhile the matchmaking system is a logical system that has built in settings. it isn't just randomly picking up marbles, it KNOWS which marble is red and which marble is blue and it should PURPOSELY try always get the same amount of red and blue. What dynamic queue has done is vastly increase the amount of one marble making the system unable to make sure you have a 50/50 chance.

It isn't cheating logic because my example isn't about the method of the statistics, it's pointing out the viewpoint. You're calling rito a liar just because your view of the results are 2/10 so their % must clearly be wrong, when in reality it very well could just be a small sample size and that it will even out in the long run, aligning with the statistics they labeled.

I got 2 gemstones in my first 3 chests so clearly everyone else is wrong, the odds of a gemstone are 2/3.

I got no gemstones in the next 7, so clearly they're impossible to get.

As for the thread as a whole, premades dont autowin a game. Silver games are decided by the weakest player in the game, not tiny advantages like trios or lane matchups. Such low-level games are always winnable so stop looking for an excuse to lose.

if the <1% chance is true, there is 0.0096%(count it as 1% chance of unfairly match) of getting 2 unfairly matched game in 6 games. when the odd stack so unevenly, and it still happened, it is really reasonable to question if the given chance is much lower than the actual chance.

I mean, IT IS POSSIBLE, but the odd makes it seems SUSPICIOUS.

I recommend a high school statistics class. The statistics in your marble scenario would be that eventually the results even out around 50/50 because it's completely blind, and therefore relatively random. That's something I don't want in my ranked games, a randomness of premades. The point of the DynamicQ system is that it knows where the premades are and where to allocate them for the theoretically best scenario.

And besides, 50/50 is a **_theoretical_** probability. If Riot is releasing **_theoretical_** data, then it's not data. It's bullshit.
ye, that's what it's doing. its putting them where it can fit them. the system is playing the hardest game of tetris ever, just be happy queue times aren't 30 minutes long.

Except in this case it has thousands of pieces to choose from to make the best match. So in low elo there's no excuse for that.

Also, the tetris game would be a hell of a lot simpler if every piece was just a 1x1 square.
it would also be the most boring game of tetris ever

play 10 000 games, then use that as your sample.

small samples are inherently misleading. if i flip a coin ten times I might get ten heads. doesn't mean that there isn't a tails.

If you have 10000 cards in a deck, which was claim to be fully random and has only 1 joker, you draw a card then shuffle it, rinse and repeat for 6 times and you got 2 jokers, you don't really need to do it 10000 times to realize there is something wrong with either the deck or the statement.

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000b000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-06-08T21:13:15.170+0000)
>
> If you have 10000 cards in a deck, which was claim to be fully random and has only 1 joker, you draw a card then shuffle it, rinse and repeat for 6 times and you got 2 jokers, you don't really need to do it 10000 times to realize there is something wrong with either the deck or the statement.

Nobody claimed this deck was random, that was your own assumption. Even crits are not actually random. This too was your own assumption if you thought this was the case.
random in terms of drawing the card..

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000b00000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T21:29:21.541+0000)
>
> random in terms of drawing the card..

even if random actually existed, the deck your thread about isn't guaranteed to be 100% random. Nobody promised you this.
even if it is 100% random, that's what random means. it means that any draw can be anything, even the same as last draw. being mad that you got the same draw twice is straight up stupid.

I think you don't understand the point.

take a normal deck of 52 cards. if you draw 6 times, and shuffle it between each draw, and get a queen of hearts twice, is the deck wrong.

If you say yes, you are stupid, because you will be able to look through the deck, and see that the deck is a normal deck.

That is what you are saying, because it is randomized, and you got something random more than once, that it is bad, when in reality, that is something that can happen, its not something that is particularly unusual.

now if you had gone in like 4000 games and gotten like 800 games of it, then there might be an issue, but 2 out of 10 on the small scale is perfectly acceptable.
oh no one game with slightly subpar matchmaking truly your gaming career is ruined
your blindness is unbelievable. there are threads complaining about matchmaking every single day on the board and reddit, it's not just "one single game".

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000f0000,timestamp=2016-06-08T16:14:36.087+0000)
>
> your blindness is unbelievable. there are threads complaining about matchmaking every single day on the board and reddit, it's not just "one single game".

And it's hilarious how often I go through their matchmaking history and find out they've actually had extremely good matchmaking for 9/10 of their last matches yet they are still crying their eyes out over one game.

So you are saying it's ok to have shit matchmaking for 10% of the games, damn.
And you can't check if a game has premade after a week or so, op.gg only shows recent premade histories.

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000f000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T16:20:24.094+0000)
>
> So you are saying it's ok to have shit matchmaking for 10% of the games, damn.

There are always going to be a few imperfect matches, removing that is impossible. If you say there weren't bad matches in previous seasons then you are lying.

when it happens so frequently due to a terrible system then it is a problem.
also in solo queue bad matchmaking can only be difference in ranks, not difference in premade numbers.

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000f00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T16:36:01.830+0000)
>
> when it happens so frequently due to a terrible system then it is a problem.
> also in solo queue bad matchmaking can only be difference in ranks, not difference in premade numbers.

How frequent is "so frequently"?

Because you are complaining about a single game out of dozens, and the other complaints you talk about almost always end up being the same kind of hyperbolic nonsense.
I had played 6~7 ranked games and already 2 of them has extremely unfairly matched premade number(one being 2+2+1vs full solo and the other 3+1+1 vs full solo), how is that not frequent enough?

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000f0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T17:06:00.722+0000)
>
> I had played 6~7 ranked games and already 2 of them has extremely unfairly matched premade number(one being 2+2+1vs full solo and the other 3+1+1 vs full solo), how is that not frequent enough?

You've played way more than 7 ranked games.

I am talking about the games I recently played?
Do you want to count in my ranked games from last year too and claim the sample size is actually bigger fam?

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RwpKighE,comment-id=000f000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T17:56:02.810+0000)
>
> I am talking about the games I recently played?

umm you don't get to just draw the sample around whatever stretch of games most benefits your hypothesis? you have to look at an objectively collected sample that doesn't have any bias? otherwise you've done nothing but waste everyone's time?

You should probably quit crying cause 3 of the enemies may or may not have a lil extra co-operation.

You play ranked to test yourself. 
to push the limits
To Test Yourself.


This is Ranked.
This isn't a place for crybabies.

dynamic queue really tests my skill with my bot lane keep losing lane due to enemy bot lane having voice communication.
I crushed my lane opponent but have to basically 1v3 the enemy top mid and jg since bot lane is getting destoryed by voice communicated coordinations and they don't need to gank it, that really tests my skill.
well spoke sir
To be fair, that might as well happened against non-premades anyways.
except against non premade the enemy bot lane is simply better than your bot lane, but against premade the enemy bot lane is probabaly just abusing voice communication advantage which is unfair.
Guess what..  duo bot on Skype has been a thing forever. It is nothing new. You could do it well before DQ.  So please stop with these bs posts
In solo queue you can only have 1 duo in a team and they will always be matched against another duo.
That's not true. You could have 2 Duos And A SOLO On The Enemy team. Get your shit straight bb.

source?

and even if that was possible, duos were discourged by rito and the number of duos in solo queue was not nearly close to the amount of premades in dynamic queue.

Lol. Duos were not discouraged so long as you were near same mmr. As for source I've been playing since season 1 and I can remember a couple times it was me and buddy duod and when we got to talking we had another duo on the team.

op.gg says otherwise.
you are silver season5 and you were never ranked in previous seasons lmao.
